Chap. 15 - A Cause of Discouragement.


                          St. Helena, Cal., Nov. 13, 1902. 

     In the night season I was in a council with a few who were in perplexity. Many companies were presented to me as confused, in darkness, sad and discouraged, because so many were stirred by feelings of opposition to the work in the Southern field. While there were some who felt the burden of the work in this field, there were others who tried to counterwork any efforts made in behalf of the work.
